net.cloud.gfx.sprites

Class SpriteManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.sprites.SpriteManager

  • public class SpriteManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The front to the sprite operation. This class has links to the storage of sprites, and is where to go if you want to get a sprite. It internally handles loading and storage of sprites.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.awt.image.BufferedImage DEFAULT_IMAGE
      An image to use when all else fails and a sprite cannot be obtained

      Singleton instance of the sprite manager
      private SpriteLoader spriteLoader
      We'll create an instance of SpriteLoader, then just use that object to take care of loading intricacies
      private java.util.EnumMap<SpriteSet,SpriteCollection> spriteMap
      Map from the type of set to the collection of sprites

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpriteManager

        private SpriteManager()
               throws FileRequestException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Default constructor for singleton pattern. Initializes the map of sprites and will also initiate the loading of any sprite sets that are set to load on startup.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a sprite file could not be opened
        FileRequestException - If a sprite file could not be read

    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static SpriteManager instance()
        Obtain the singleton instance of the sprite manager. If this is the first call to this method, expect some delays as the SpriteManager loads the sprites that are set to be loaded on startup.
        Returns:
        The SpriteManager

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(int spriteID)
        Convenience method for retrieving a sprite from the DEFAULT set. If the sprite has not yet been loaded, then loading will take place - there may be a small delay in the retrieval while this happens.
        Parameters:
        spriteID - The index of the sprite within the set
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage representing the requested sprite

      • getSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSprite(SpriteSet set,
                                              int spriteID)
        Obtain a sprite (in the form of a BufferedImage). The sprite is retrieved from the given set. If the sprite has not yet been loaded, then loading will take place - there may be a small delay in the retrieval while this happens.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite belongs to
        spriteID - The index of the sprite within the set
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage representing the requested sprite

      • getScaledSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getScaledSprite(SpriteSet set,
                                                    int spriteID,
                                                    int width,
                                                    int height)
        Obtain a scaled sprite in the form of a BufferedImage. This relies on normal sprite retrieval. Then if the requested size already matches the original sprite, that original is returned. Otherwise, a scaled image is created (with some existing render hints) and returned. Leaving width or height -1 will maintain the width or height of the original. Leaving both -1 will result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite belongs to
        spriteID - The index of the sprite within the set
        width - The desire width of the scaled image. -1 maintains ratio with height
        height - The desired height of the scaled image -1 maintains ratio with width
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage that may be the original sprite, or a new image. Right size either way.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If both width and height are -1

      • getScaledSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getScaledSprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage original,
                                                    int width,
                                                    int height)
        Obtain a scaled sprite in the form of a BufferedImage. This utilizes an existing image. Then if the requested size already matches the original sprite, that original is returned. Otherwise, a scaled image is created (with some existing render hints) and returned. Leaving width or height -1 will maintain the width or height of the original. Leaving both -1 will result in an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        original - The image to scale
        width - The desire width of the scaled image. -1 maintains ratio with height
        height - The desired height of the scaled image -1 maintains ratio with width
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage that may be the original sprite, or a new image. Right size either way.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If both width and height are -1

      • getTiledSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTiledSprite(SpriteSet set,
                                                   int spriteID,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height)
        Obtain an image which is tiled rather than scaled to the given size. If the size is smaller than the image normally would be, it will be cropped. If the desired size is larger, the returned image will be the sprite laid out end-to-end with cropping on the edges to fit the size.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the desired sprite is in
        spriteID - The ID of the desired sprite
        width - The width of the tiled image
        height - The height of the tiled image
        Returns:
        An image of the desired size with the sprite tiled and/or cropped

      • getTiledSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTiledSprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage original,
                                                   int width,
                                                   int height)
        Obtain an image which is tiled rather than scaled to the given size. If the size is smaller than the image already is, it will be cropped. If the desired size is larger, the returned image will be the original laid out end-to-end with cropping on the edges to fit the size. -1 May be used for a single dimension to maintain the original
        Parameters:
        original - The image to tile
        width - The width of the tiled image
        height - The height of the tiled image
        Returns:
        An image of the desired size with the original image tiled and/or cropped
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If both width and height are -1

      • getRotatedSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getRotatedSprite(SpriteSet set,
                                                     int spriteID,
                                                     int rotation)
        Obtain a rotated sprite. The rotation is in degrees. This will always give back a new image, rather than the original. The rotation is around the center point of the sprite.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the original sprite is in
        spriteID - The ID of the original sprite
        rotation - The amount of rotation, in degrees
        Returns:
        A sprite rotated the given amount

      • getRotatedSprite

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getRotatedSprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage original,
                                                     int rotation)
        Obtain a rotated sprite. The rotation is in degrees. This will always give back a new image, rather than the original. The rotation is around the center point of the sprite.
        Parameters:
        original - The image to rotate
        rotation - The amount of rotation, in degrees
        Returns:
        An image rotated the given amount

      • initMap

        private void initMap()
              throws FileRequestException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Initialize the sprite map. Places entries for each enumerable.
        Throws:
        FileRequestException - If a sprite file could not be opened
        java.io.IOException - If a sprite file could not be read

      • loadStartupSprites

        private void loadStartupSprites()
                         throws FileRequestException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Load all of the sprite sets that request they be loaded on application startup. This will attempt to load every sprite all such sets, not just a subset.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a sprite file could not be read into a sprite
        FileRequestException - If a set's data could not be retrieved
